HOMEWOOD, BALTIMORE, MD., APRIL 12, 1929

JAY RUNNERS BEAT
UNIV. OF DELAWARE

COTILLON CLUB
URGES ATTENDANCE
Because of the fact that
about twenty couples arrived
at the C. E. Hall last Saturday
night and left because no one
was there, the first twenty couples to arrive before 9.45 will
be admitted free tomorrow
night. For the late comers the
price will be $1.00 stag or couple as usual. The dance will
be from 9 to 12 with Os Steinwald furnishing the music.
John -Eldridge, president of
Cotillon Club, announced that
there would be some colorful
entertainment as an added attraction. If the attendance at
these Saturday night dances
does not improve they will
have to be discontinued.

BARNSTORMER CLUB
HOLDS ELECTIONS
The Barnstormer Club held
elections at its annual banquet
last Saturday night. Those
elected will go into office at
the close of this year and will
hold the, office for the entire
following season. As president Bill Banks will be succeeded by Jack Deets while
the remainder of the executive
board will consist of: Dick
Berney, secretary; Addison
Campbell, production manager,
and Max Sauerwein, business
manager.

COTILLON CLUB
URGES ATTENDANCE
Because of the fact that
about twenty couples arrived
at the C. E. Hall last Saturday
night and left because no one
was there, the first twenty couples to arrive before 9.45 will
be admitted free tomorrow
night. For the late comers the
price will be $1.00 stag or couple as usual. The dance will
be from 9 to 12 with Os Steinwald furnishing the music.
John -Eldridge, president of
Cotillon Club, announced that
there would be some colorful
entertainment as an added attraction. If the attendance at
these Saturday night dances
does not improve they will
have to be discontinued.

BARNSTORMER CLUB
HOLDS ELECTIONS
The Barnstormer Club held
elections at its annual banquet
last Saturday night. Those
elected will go into office at
the close of this year and will
hold the, office for the entire
following season. As president Bill Banks will be succeeded by Jack Deets while
the remainder of the executive
board will consist of: Dick
Berney, secretary; Addison
Campbell, production manager,
and Max Sauerwein, business
manager.
